page.title: 05ECOLOGY..POLLUTION
page.content: We are fortunate that our area is attractive farmland but there is an awareness that farm chemicals can create problems.Every farm in our area has its own well water supply.Each is about 5 to 10 metres deep and can be relied on throughout the year.However,there is some concern that the well water now contains a high level of nitrates,the result of run-off from nitrogen fertilisers which are applied to farm crops, especially cereals. In addition chemical run off from pesticide sprays and sheep dip water can find its way into this underground water and create problems. The local Agricultural College stresses the need for great care when spraying crops. The River Tay Purification Board carefully monitors the water quality in the Ladyburn,our only important stream.
